basics.name: Daniel Folino
basics.label: Chemical Engineering and Computer Science Student
basics.summary: Driven senior with a double major in Chemical Engineering and Computer Science, and minors in Chemistry and Mathematics at the University of Colorado Boulder. Passionate about interdisciplinary projects, innovative solutions, and bringing global experience from academic and professional backgrounds. Fluent in four languages and proficient in advanced technical and analytical skills.

work.name: University of Colorado Boulder
work.summary: Supporting CHEN 4520 under Professor Wendy Young, assisting students with advanced chemical engineering concepts and facilitating their academic success.
highlights: Guided students in mastering complex chemical engineering topics.
Contributed to a dynamic learning environment by providing individualized support.
Increased exam scores by 30% and engagement by 25% through custom study guides.

work.name: Outlier AI
work.summary: Engineered and optimized prompts for LLMs to enhance output quality in a Linux environment.
highlights: Improved response accuracy by 25% and reduced error rates by 15%.
Cut iteration cycles by 40% through testing and Agile workflows.

work.name: Hospital Angeles
work.summary: Interned in a healthcare environment, shadowing medical staff and contributing to efficient patient record management.
highlights: Documented patient histories to ensure accurate and accessible medical records.
Observed healthcare operations, gaining insights into clinical workflows and patient care protocols.

work.name: Interstellar X
work.summary: Developed an exploratory game in C++ featuring interplanetary travel and challenges.
highlights: Created game logic in C++ for an immersive travel and exploration experience.
Implemented gameplay mechanics and 2D/3D rendering functions.

work.name: MovieSeekers
work.summary: Built a database for efficient data retrieval using C and C++ structures.
highlights: Implemented skip lists and hash tables to optimize query performance.
Improved data indexing and storage for scalable data handling.

work.name: Bomb Lab
work.summary: Analyzed and disassembled assembly-level code, applying C language knowledge for program analysis.
highlights: Utilized disassembly tools to understand binary instructions.
Identified logic flows and potential vulnerabilities.

education.description: High School diploma with proficiency in German, Spanish, and English at C2 level.

projects.name: Financial Market Predictor
projects.summary: Developed a market prediction tool using ML models with 89% accuracy on ETFs and hedge funds.
highlights: Applied AdaBoost and Random Forest with hyperparameter tuning.
Implemented cross-validation and reduced model variance by 20%.

projects.name: Mancala Game Agent
projects.summary: AI player built with Minimax and Alpha-Beta pruning reaching 85% win rate.
highlights: Optimized heuristics and reduced decision latency by 40%.
Ran simulations to enhance strategic play.

projects.name: California Wildfire Prediction
projects.summary: Applied Lagrange and extrapolation methods for predictive wildfire analysis with 92% confidence.
highlights: Improved risk mitigation planning by 30%.
Developed visual dashboards to communicate results.

projects.name: Take-A-Note (HackCU11)
projects.summary: Created AI-powered note-taker with GPT-4 and Whisper for lecture summarization.
highlights: Achieved 95% transcription accuracy.
Cut processing time under 10s for 25MB videos.

projects.name: 3M DAC Techno-Economic Analysis
projects.summary: Modeled CO2 capture system using MATLAB and collaborated with 3M to reach 10% IRR.
highlights: Reduced simulation error by 20% using Toth isotherms.
Improved cost projections through sensitivity analysis.

projects.name: Tirzepatide Process Design
projects.summary: Optimized drug synthesis route using Aspen Plus and MATLAB for ROI and throughput gain.
highlights: Lowered energy use by 20% and capital cost by 12%.
Achieved 30% ROI through process simulation.

awards.summary: Gold medal in handball for Mexico at the Central American Games.

awards.title: ABITUR Graduation
awards.summary: Graduated with a score of 1.7 and C2 level proficiency in German, Spanish, and English.

awards.title: Black Belt in Taekwondo
awards.summary: Achieved Black Belt level in Taekwondo, demonstrating dedication and discipline.
